data.name: TEXT_ADJ_APPROVE
data.value: Möchten Sie wirklich fortfahren? Durch diesen unumkehrbaren Schritt werden alle Anpassungen genehmigt, die mit Ihren Filterkriterien übereinstimmen. Wenn keine Filter vorhanden sind, werden alle Anpassungen im System genehmigt.

data.name: TEXT_ADJ_DELETE
data.value: Möchten Sie wirklich fortfahren? Durch diesen unwiderruflichen Schritt werden alle Anpassungen gelöscht, die mit Ihren Filterkriterien übereinstimmen. Wenn keine Filter vorhanden sind, werden alle Anpassungen im System gelöscht.

data.name: TEXT_ADJ_DENIED
data.value: Möchten Sie wirklich fortfahren? Durch diesen unwiderruflichen Schritt werden alle Anpassungen verweigert, die mit Ihren Filterkriterien übereinstimmen. Wenn keine Filter vorhanden sind, werden alle Anpassungen im System verweigert.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVAL_CHANGES_PENDING_YOUR_APPROVAL
data.value: Änderungen, für die Ihre Genehmigung aussteht

data.name: TEXT_APPROVAL_NO_CHANGES_PENDING_YOUR_APPROVAL
data.value: Es gibt keine ausstehenden Änderungen, die Sie genehmigen können.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_ACTION_APPROVE_TIP
data.value: Durch Genehmigen dieser Änderungen stimmen Sie zu, dass diese Änderung in das System übernommen wird.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_ACTION_RESUBMIT_TIP
data.value: Durch eine erneuten Übermittlung wird erneut versucht, diese genehmigte Änderung auf das System anzuwenden.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_APPLIED
data.value: Diese Änderung wurde auf das System angewendet. Es sind keine weiteren Maßnahmen erforderlich.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_APPROVEDWAITINGTOBEAPPLIED
data.value: Diese Änderung wurde genehmigt und muss noch auf das System angewendet werden.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_DISMISSED
data.value: Diese Änderung wurde verworfen. Es sind keine weiteren Maßnahmen möglich.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_FAILEDTOAPPLY
data.value: Diese Änderung wurde genehmigt, konnte jedoch nicht auf das System angewendet werden.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_SUBMITTER
data.value: Da Sie diese ausstehende Änderung übermittelt haben, können Sie sie verwerfen. Dadurch wird sie nicht mehr zur Prüfung vorgelegt.

data.name: TEXT_CONFIRM_APPROVE_NS_CONTINUE
data.value: Möchten Sie wirklich fortfahren? Durch diesen unumkehrbaren Schritt werden alle außerordentlichen Gebühren genehmigt, die mit Ihren Filterkriterien übereinstimmen. Wenn keine Filter vorhanden sind, werden alle außerordentlichen Gebühren im System genehmigt.

data.name: TEXT_CONFIRM_DENY_NS_CONTINUE
data.value: Möchten Sie wirklich fortfahren? Durch diesen unwiderruflichen Schritt werden alle außerordentlichen Gebühren verweigert, die mit Ihren Filterkriterien übereinstimmen. Wenn keine Filter vorhanden sind, werden alle außerordentlichen Gebühren im System verweigert.

data.name: TEXT_VALIDATION_ERROR
data.value: Auf dieser Seite sind Validierungsfehler aufgetreten. Bitte füllen Sie die erforderlichen Felder aus.

data.name: TEXT_VIEW_AUDIT_FAILED_TRANSACTION
data.value: Audit für diese fehlgeschlagene Transaktion anzeigen

data.name: TEXT_WILL_LOSE_CHANGES
data.value: [DE]You will lose the changes you have made.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_GENERAL_INFO
data.value:
A Decision is used to analyze usage records (rated billing records) and possibly modify charges on the basis of this analysis. Decisions are necessary when it is impossible to determine the amount by examining a single isolated record.
For example, you may want to give a special rate if the number of telephone minutes used during the month is > 1000. You can only determine the rate to use after adding up all the usage records. If the minutes are > 1000, then for each record the rate is changed and a new charge amount is calculated.[DE]

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_PARAM_TABLE
data.value:
[DE]A Decision Type must be associated with a Parameter Table, which provides a way to customize key values of the Decision Type. For example, you might want the 'number of free minutes' to be editable rather than a fixed value.

Before a Decision Type is configured, its associated Parameter Table must be created using the Integrated Configuration Environment (ICE).

NOTE: After you click Next, you cannot choose a different parameter table for this decision type.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_ACCOUNT_GROUP
data.value:
[DE]Example: One account (a parent) is billed for activity on child accounts. You want to find the total of all charges (parent and children).

In addition to pulling in other accounts, you want to ignore the Decision Type for some accounts. For example, you want the Decision Type to apply only to accounts that receive paperless bills.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_CUSTOM_ACCT_GRP
data.value: [DE]For more information about how to create a new Account Group, see the documentation or contact your MetraTech representative.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_SELECT_USAGE_QUALIFICATION
data.value: [DE]By default, when working on a Decision Type for a given time span (interval- or calendar-based), AMP forms the usage by considering all the Product View records that belong to an account for that time span. You might want to ignore certain records, such as in a Decision Type that analyzes only the usage of \"toll telephone call minutes\".

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_SUCCESS_RESORTING_GRID
data.value: [DE]Operation succeeded. The grid will be resorted.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_ERROR_ACTIVATE_DECISION
data.value: [DE]Error occured when activating/deactivating the Decision Type:

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_ITEMS_TO_AGGREGATE
data.value: [DE]For example, suppose the Decision Type is \"Use a special rate if the number of minutes of usage is over 500\". The settings might include \"500\" and the \"special rate\" to apply.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AGGREGATION_METHOD
data.value: [DE]Decisions are used when a monetary charge amount cannot be calculated by looking at a single record. Instead, many usage records must be examined and a total must be the number of events, units of usage, or charge amounts. The total, or aggregate, is then used to help determine the charge amount.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DECISION_PRIORITY
data.value:
[DE]Example: There are two decisions that consider the same usage record. Both decisions are configured to consume the usage records.

The decisions' priority levels determine the order in which to process the decisions. A lower numeric priority level is processed earlier than a higher priority level. Decisions that have the same priority level are processed in nondeterministic order. On the Decision Priority page you can specify the priority level of the decision type you are now configuring.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_USAGE_OVERLAP
data.value: [DE]Example: One Decision Type totals \"minutes\" and \"all minutes < 1000 are free\". A second Decision Type totals \"minutes\", but you want to count only the minutes that are not part of the 1000. You want the second Decision Type to consider only those minutes that were not consumed by the first Decision Type. To accomplish this, set the Decision Domain for both Decision Types to 'Ratable'.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AMOUNT_CHAIN_GROUP
data.value:
[DE]Select an Amount Chain Group so that the Decision Type knows what to count and how to recalculate related values.

Example: A certain Amount Chain has four related fields in a Product View: \"the number of minutes used\", \"the rate per minute\", \"the charge amount\", and \"the tax on the charge amount\".

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_AMP_UI_NAME_ILLEGAL_CHAR
data.value: [DE]The name cannot contain single or double quote characters.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_HOW_APPLY
data.value:
[DE]- If the charge/credit is applied proportionally, the following fraction of the chagre/credit value is applied:
(the total - range start) / (range end - range start)
- If the charge/credit is applied inversely proportionally, the following fraction of the chagre/credit value is applied:
(range end - the total) / (range end - range start)
- If the charge/credit is applied as an aggregate multiplier, the amount of the chagre/credit is computed as:
(charge or credit value) * (aggregated value for the Decision)
where the aggregated value can be money, units of usage, or events.
- Otherwise, the entire charge/credit value is applied.

data.name: TITLE_AMPWIZARD_HELP_HOW_APPLY
data.value: [DE]Help: How should the Charge/Credit be applied?

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DECISION_RANGE
data.value: [DE]For example, you are aggregating by amount and you want something special to happen every $1000.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_DECISION_RANGE
data.value: [DE]Example: Apply a special rate if 'total minutes are between 500 and 1000' or if 'the number of tolls is greater than 5'.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_DECISION_RANGE_PRORATION
data.value:
[DE]The proration factor to apply to the range is determined by comparing the intended start and end dates of a Decision Type instance with the actual start and end dates of that instance. Example: If a Decision is intended to include 30 days of usage but really only covers 15 days (that is, the subscription starts or ends mid-period), the proration factor would be 15/30, or 0.5. If the end of range is 500 before proration, it becomes 250 after applying the proration factor.

Prorating on activation and termination independently allows the user control of whether activation or termination reduces the proration factor. Example: If a Decision starts 15 days into the cycle, but proration on activation is not chosen, those 15 days will not reduce the proration factor.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AMOUNT_CHAIN_GROUP_2
data.value: [DE]The Decision Settings have already specified how to calculate the generated charge amount. Now select the Amount Chain Group, which specifies: (a) the field in the Product View in which the generated charge amount should be stored and (b) any other fields that need to be recalculated.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_PRODUCT_VIEW
data.value: [DE]The Product View's table in the MetraNet database holds values associated with the new Charge/Credit.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_INCREMENTAL_OR_BULK
data.value: [DE]Act on each record individually means that the decision takes a record, adds it to the total, and if the total is within the range, performs an action. Act on all the records together means that the decision totals ALL the records, and if the total falls within the range, applies the action to ALL the records.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_UNIT_RATE
data.value:
[DE]This new rate is applied by setting the \"amount\" associated with the Decision Type to the new rate multiplied by the usage. Any fields that are derived from \"amount\" are then recalculated.
Example: After the range is met, the charge amount is 0.50 per minute.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_EVENT_RATE
data.value:
[DE]This new rate is applied by setting the \"amount\" associated with the Decision Type to this new value. Any fields that are derived from \"amount\" are then recalculated.
Example: After the range is met, \"the toll cost is $0.75\" or \"the call costs $1, regardless of the number of minutes\".

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DISCOUNT
data.value:
[DE]This discount is applied to the \"amount\" associated with the Decision Type. Any fields that are derived from \"amount\" are then recalculated.

The discount might be applied to only a portion of the amount if your Decision Type aggregates usage.

Example: The range start is \"500 minutes\" and the total is currently \"400 minutes\". The Decision processes a record with \"300 minutes\". \"100 minutes\" fall outside the range and \"200 minutes\" fall inside the range. If the discount is 5%, then \"amount\" is decreased by 0.05 x (200/300).

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_GENERATED_CHARGE
data.value: [DE]Choose this option to have the Decision Type generate a new Charge or Credit. You will define the Charge/Credit on the next set of screens.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_GENERATED_CHARGE_GRID
data.value: [DE]Each Generated Charge/Credit in the grid is associated with a Product View and specifies how to set the fields in the Product View and in t_acc_usage.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_DECISION_CYCLE
data.value: [DE]For example, maybe the billing cycle is monthly, but you want to give a special rate if \"more than 1000 minutes are used in three months\". This is known as the Decision Cycle.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_CHARGE_CREDIT_DIRECTIVE
data.value:
[DE]As part of generating a charge or credit, a directive can do the following types of work:
- Table Inclusion - Join to a database table or view. All fields from the selected row in the included table or view will be added as fields to the object in memory.
- Field Population - Populate a field of the object in memory by evaluating an expression or by assigning a default value.
- Procedure Execution - Execute an MVM procedure. Procedure execution provides a mechanism for doing anything that cannot be accomplished through table inclusion and field population.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DIRECTIVES
data.value: [DE]This table shows which fields in the product view and t_acc_usage have Field Population directives defined for them, Use this table to determine which fields still need to be set.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_DIRECTIVES
data.value: [DE]Description of different types of steps: database table inclusion, field population, procedure execution

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_USAGE_QUALIFICATION
data.value: [DE]You can create Usage Qualifications that reference other Usage Qualifications that were defined previously. For example, a usage record can also meet other previously defined conditions.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_FILTER
data.value:
[DE]In the filter, you can check for specific values of product view fields and t_acc_usage fields, or you can check if other Usage Qualifications (that you have already built) are satisfied. You can use parentheses and the keywords \"and\", \"or\", \"==\", \"!=\", and \"!\". Use the Insert buttons to insert snippets of the filter at the cursor.

In the filter, \"OBJECT\" refers to the usage record and \"GROUP\" refers to another usage qualification group.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_DELETE_DIRECTIVE_CONFIRM
data.value: [DE]Are you sure you want to delete this directive?

data.name: TEXT_DELETE_BS_EXEMPTION
data.value: [DE]Are you sure you want to delete this BillSoft Exemption?

data.name: TEXT_DELETE_BS_OVERRIDE
data.value: [DE]Are you sure you want to delete this BillSoft Override?

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_DELETE_ACCOUNT_QUALIFICATION_CONFIRM
data.value: [DE]Are you sure you want to delete this Account Qualification?

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DIRECTIVE_FILTER
data.value: [DE]The Condition for Execution is a freeform MVM expression that is evaluated when the directive is about to be executed. If the expression evaluates to 1, the directive is executed. If the expression evaluates to a value other than 1, the directive is NOT executed. This field applies to Table Inclusion, Field Population, and Procedure Execution.

data.name: ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_STARTDATE_BIGGER_ENDDATE
data.value: [DE]Start Date can't be greater than End Date

data.name: TEXT_SELECT_PO_ERROR
data.value: [DE]Please select product offerings to be added

data.name: TEXT_CONVERT_MESSAGE
data.value: [DE]Are you sure that you want to convert quote to subscriptions?

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_INVALID_UQG_NAME
data.value: [DE]The value in this field is invalid. Valid Usage Qualification names can only consist of alphanumeric characters (Aa-Zz, 0-9) and the underscore '_' character.

data.name: TEXT_TERMINATE_SELECTED_ROWS
data.value: Are you sure you want to terminate selected rows?

data.value: Are you sure that you want to update OnBoard template?

data.value: Are you sure you want to terminate {0}?

data.value: No parameter was selected. Please select at least one parameter for assignment
